pages.title: Aloe
pages.text: These drought-loving plants are able to grow almost everywhere. Ironically, as sturdy as they are, they can not handle too much light and nutrient-rich soil. Down here, there was simply no reason to adapt to that, you guess.
You can break off individual leaves. They retain a lot of moisture and are quite nutritious.$(br)Planted, they will grow into a full-fledged new plant over time.
